subject: Re: [junit] Changes in Code not reflected in execution -why's that???
msgSnippet: ... Sounds like a classpath problem. Mike
messageBody:
omineo wrote:

>Group,
>
>I've been trying to provide some extra functions to the existing
>JUNIT3.7. And I've been meddling with the code from the src.jar file.
>My problem is that, though I change the code (and then repackage it
>into a jar file or just remove the jar file and put the src directory
>instead of it) my changes are not reflected while execution.
>
>Even simple statements like System.out.println("Testing"); or writer
>().println() in this case are not working.
>

Sounds like a classpath problem.

Mike
